title: Torino chief explains why Joe Hart could be tempted to make permanent switch to Italy from Man City
text:
Torino chief explains why Joe Hart could be tempted to make permanent switch to Italy from Man City President Urbano Cairo explains why the England No.1 could be tempted to remain with the Italians Share Joe Hart was spotted enjoying a city break in Rome with his wife Kimberly (Photo: XPOSUREPHOTOS.COM) Share Get football     
Torino claim Joe Hart would be happy staying at the Serie A side next season. 
The Manchester City outcast is on loan at Torino for the campaign and the Italian side are keen to make the England No 1's stay permanent. 
President Urbano Cairo believes Hart could be tempted to remain with them because he is enjoying playing for them. "We have an excellent relationship with him," said Cairo. 
"He is happy to stay in Turin and we can work on it. Hart has impressed in Serie A this season (Photo: Getty Images) Torino insist they have an excellent relationship with the England No.1 (Photo: Rex) Hart has been linked with a return to the Premier League this summer Read More Manchester City join race to sign Andrea Belotti as Torino president says his Â£86m buy-out clause is too cheap "It depends on City, but I think Hart would be happy to remain. We'll see what City have in mind and want to do." It is understood Hart, who was pictured out and about in Italy with his partner Kimberly, is keen to assess all his options in the summer after Pep Guardiola made it clear last week that he sees Claudio Bravo and Willy Caballero as his two senior goalkeepers.
